meanings.definition: A person who performs feats in the air on a trapeze, tightrope, or other apparatus.
meanings.sent1: The talented aerialist gracefully swung from the trapeze.
meanings.sent2: The circus featured an amazing aerialist who wowed the audience with daring stunts.
meanings.sent3: The aerialist tried juggling while hanging from the trapeze, causing laughter in the crowd.
meanings.sent4: Her movements in the air made her seem like an aerialist dancing with the wind.
meanings.sent5: The young girl dreamt of becoming an aerialist soaring through the clouds one day.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the air or atmosphere.
meanings.sent1: The pilot explained the aerialist maneuvers of the aircraft during the flight.
meanings.sent2: The balloon festival showcased various aerialist displays against the blue sky.
meanings.sent3: The aerialist view from the mountaintop was breathtaking, making them feel on top of the world.
meanings.sent4: The aerialist quality of the music seemed to lift the spirits of everyone in the room.
meanings.sent5: The kite's aerialist movements in the wind mesmerized the children playing in the park.
